group_1.textCenter: Right now, in the real world, the people@sharing this dream...
It's you two and Amy, correct?

group_1.textRight: To the best of our knowledge, yes.

group_1.textLeft: And if we count Mami and the others who@reached the goal first,
that makes six people and one animal in total!

group_1.textRight: ...Just to be clear, you're different, aren't you?
Like I told you before,
I'm a different entity from my real world self,@existing only in this dream.
So, according to what you said, the commonality@among those six people and one animal is...

group_1.textLeft: They all slept with the origami nearby.

group_1.textRight: Exactly.

group_1.textLeft: But we were sleeping at Mami's house.

group_1.textRight: Considering that, the reason everyone found@themselves in this dream...
is likely due to the origami itself.

group_1.textLeft: So it wasn't because Nagisa kicked them@that the dreams got mixed up...!

group_1.textRight: Right, even if Nagisa hadn't done anything,
I think you all might have ended up in a similar@situation anyway.
When I, in the real world, cast a spell on@that paper,
I might have made a mistake in the adjustment.
I'm really sorry about this...
So, regarding what you mentioned earlier,
the idea that this dream world might@belong to Amy...
What exactly did you mean by that?
Let's assume this world is a mixture of the@dreams of six people and a cat,
That would imply the dream belongs to all@of us, right?
Right, but there's one thing I'm most@curious about.
Which is the fact that Amy's origami was@the only one with nothing written on it.
Before you went to sleep,
you all wrote your resolutions and wishes for@this year on your origamis, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes...I still can't remember what I wrote, though.
But all six of us definitely wrote something!

group_1.textRight: Kyoko and Sayaka wrote about "winning"@this year, didn't they?
They were strangely obsessed with "winning".
Could that be why?
The first dream spell was as follows:
"What you write on the origami will come true@in your dreams." Isn't that right?
So if you write "I'm going to win this year,"@you'll dream about "winning," right?
But Amy is the only one not bound by@any written word.

group_1.textLeft: Because Amy's origami paper doesn't have@anything written on it...?

group_1.textRight: Precisely!
In other words, this dream world is whatever@Amy desires.
That's what I'm thinking.
Maybe Amy decides the rules of the life-size@board game too!

group_1.textLeft: So if we can't reach the goal because we don't@meet the conditions...

group_1.textRight: Maybe you can't be released until Amy has@been satisfied?
What exactly does Amy want from this dream?

group_1.textLeft: Maybe...she just wants to play a lot?

group_1.textRight: Yes, especially since Madoka seems to be@her favorite playmate.
Perhaps that's why she won't let you go@so easily.
Yes, if you play with her until she's exhausted,
maybe she'll release you from the dream once@she's all tuckered out.
